user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_map:
```c
int metal_map(int fd, off_t offset, size_t size, int expand, int flags,
	      void **result)
{
	int prot = PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, error;
	void *mem;

	flags |= MAP_SHARED;

	if (fd < 0) {
		fd = -1;
		flags = MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANONYMOUS;
	} else if (expand) {
		off_t reqsize = offset + size;
		struct stat stat;

		error = flock(fd, LOCK_EX) < 0 ? -errno : 0;
		if (!error)
			error = fstat(fd, &stat);
		if (!error && stat.st_size < reqsize)
			error = ftruncate(fd, reqsize);
		if (!error)
			flock(fd, LOCK_UN);
		if (error)
			return -errno;
	}

	mem = mmap(NULL, size, prot, flags, fd, offset);
	if (mem == MAP_FAILED)
		return -errno;
	*result = mem;
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No unreachable code detected. The function's control flow has three mutually exclusive, reachable paths: (1) fd < 0 branch (sets fd = -1 and flags to MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANONYMOUS) then proceeds to mmap; (2) fd >= 0 and expand true branch (performs flock, fstat, ftruncate, unlock and may return on error); (3) fd >= 0 and expand false branch (skips the expand block and proceeds to mmap). There are no statements placed after an unconditional return, no cases of code behind constant-false conditions, and no constructs that can never be reached at runtime given the function parameters. Notes that some assignments are overwritten (Flags OR then later assigned for fd < 0) or that error is only referenced inside the expand branch (so it is not used uninitialized) — these are not unreachable-code issues and therefore do not require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
